title: EU-Mercosur agreement: Do Brussels' latest measures offer greater protection?
subhead: With a safeguard clause, mirror measures and tighter controls, the European Union has made several proposals since September to address concerns over the free trade deal with Mercosur. But the deal itself remains unchanged and the new provisions have yet to be clearly defined.

title: Louvre workers vote to extend a strike at the world's most visited museum
subhead: Unions say frustration has mounted over staff shortages, aging infrastructure and a planned increase in ticket prices for non-European visitors.

title: Gabriel Zucman, economist: 'The idea of a sclerotic Europe facing a American El Dorado has little basis in fact'
subhead: More leisure time, better health outcomes, greater equality and lower carbon emissions, all with broadly comparable productivity: Europeans can be proud of their model, argues Gabriel Zucman, director of the EU Tax Observatory.

subhead: Populism has never been stronger in France, but there is a crucial difference between flattering the people and serving them, and the Rassemblement National is currently stumbling on that divide, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: Two months after Louvre heist, French museums remain on high alert
subhead: Seven cultural institutions in France experienced burglaries with increasingly violent methods between September and October, revealing significant shortcomings in their security measures.
